com.intel.jndn.management

Class Nfdc

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intel.jndn.management.Nfdc

  • public final class Nfdc
extends Object
    Helper class for interacting with an NDN forwarder daemon; see NFD Management for explanations of the various protocols used.
    Author:
    Andrew Brown

    • Method Detail

      • getForwarderStatus

        public static ForwarderStatus getForwarderStatus(net.named_data.jndn.Face face)
                                          throws ManagementException
        Retrieve the status of the given forwarder; calls /localhost/nfd/status/general which requires a local Face (all non-local packets are dropped).
        Parameters:
        face - only a localhost Face
        Returns:
        the forwarder status object
        Throws:
        ManagementException - if the network request failed or the returned status could not be decoded
        See Also:
        ForwarderStatus

      • getFaceList

        public static List<FaceStatus> getFaceList(net.named_data.jndn.Face face)
                                    throws ManagementException
        Retrieve a list of faces and their status from the given forwarder; calls /localhost/nfd/faces/list which requires a local Face (all non-local packets are dropped).
        Parameters:
        face - only a localhost Face
        Returns:
        a list of face status objects
        Throws:
        ManagementException - if the network request failed or if the NFD rejected the request
        See Also:
        FaceManagement

      • getFibList

        public static List<FibEntry> getFibList(net.named_data.jndn.Face face)
                                 throws ManagementException
        Retrieve a list of FIB entries and their NextHopRecords from the given forwarder; calls /localhost/nfd/fib/list which requires a local Face (all non-local packets are dropped).
        Parameters:
        face - only a localhost Face
        Returns:
        a list of FIB entries
        Throws:
        ManagementException - if the network request failed or if the NFD rejected the request
        See Also:
        FIB Dataset

      • getRouteList

        public static List<RibEntry> getRouteList(net.named_data.jndn.Face face)
                                   throws ManagementException
        Retrieve a list of routing entries from the RIB; calls /localhost/nfd/rib/list which requires a local Face (all non-local packets are dropped).
        Parameters:
        face - only a localhost Face
        Returns:
        a list of RIB entries, i.e. routes
        Throws:
        ManagementException - if the network request failed or if the NFD rejected the request
        See Also:
        RIB Dataset

      • getStrategyList

        public static List<StrategyChoice> getStrategyList(net.named_data.jndn.Face face)
                                            throws ManagementException
        Retrieve the list of strategy choice entries from the NFD; calls /localhost/nfd/rib/list which requires a local Face (all non-local packets are dropped).
        Parameters:
        face - only a localhost Face
        Returns:
        a list of strategy choice entries, i.e. routes
        Throws:
        ManagementException - if the network request failed, the NFD response could not be decoded, or the NFD rejected the request
        See Also:
        StrategyChoice

        public static List<ChannelStatus> getChannelStatusList(net.named_data.jndn.Face face)
                                                throws ManagementException
        Retrieve the list of channel status entries from the NFD; calls /localhost/nfd/faces/channels which requires a local Face (all non-local packets are dropped).
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a list of channel status entries
        Throws:
        ManagementException - if the network request failed, the NFD response could not be decoded, or the NFD rejected the request
        See Also:
        Face Management

      • getKeyLocator

        public static net.named_data.jndn.KeyLocator getKeyLocator(net.named_data.jndn.Face face)
                                                    throws ManagementException
        Retrieve the KeyLocator for an NFD.
        Parameters:
        face - only a localhost Face
        Returns:
        the KeyLocator of the NFD's key
        Throws:
        ManagementException - if the network request failed, if the NFD rejected the request, or no KeyLocator was found

      • createFace

        public static int createFace(net.named_data.jndn.Face face,
                             String uri)
                      throws ManagementException
        Create a new face on the given forwarder. Ensure the forwarding face is on the local machine (management requests are to /localhost/...) and that command signing has been set up (e.g. forwarder.setCommandSigningInfo()).
        Parameters:
        face - only a localhost Face
        uri - a string like "tcp4://host.name.com" (see nfd-status channels for more protocol options)
        Returns:
        the newly created face ID
        Throws:
        ManagementException - if the network request failed, the NFD response could not be decoded, or the NFD rejected the request

      • destroyFace

        public static void destroyFace(net.named_data.jndn.Face face,
                               int faceId)
                        throws ManagementException
        Destroy a face on given forwarder. Ensure the forwarding face is on the local machine (management requests are to /localhost/...) and that command signing has been set up (e.g. forwarder.setCommandSigningInfo()).
        Parameters:
        face - only a localhost Face
        faceId - the ID of the face to destroy
        Throws:
        ManagementException - if the network request failed, the NFD response could not be decoded, or the NFD rejected the request

                                            LocalControlHeader header)
                                     throws ManagementException
        Enable a local control feature on the given forwarder.
        Parameters:
        face - only a localhost Face
        header - the control feature to enable
        Throws:
        ManagementException - if the network request failed, the NFD response could not be decoded, or the NFD rejected the request
        See Also:
        Face Management

                                             LocalControlHeader header)
                                      throws ManagementException
        Disable a local control feature on the given forwarder.
        Parameters:

      • register

        public static void register(net.named_data.jndn.Face face,
                            net.named_data.jndn.ControlParameters controlParameters)
                     throws ManagementException
        Register a route on the forwarder.

        Ensure the forwarding face is on the local machine (management requests are to /localhost/...) and that command signing has been set up (e.g. forwarder.setCommandSigningInfo()).

        Parameters:
        face - only a localhost Face
        controlParameters - the ControlParameters command options
        Throws:
        ManagementException - if the network request failed, the NFD response could not be decoded, or the NFD rejected the request
        See Also:
        nfdc, RIB Management

      • register

        public static void register(net.named_data.jndn.Face face,
                            net.named_data.jndn.Name route,
                            int cost)
                     throws ManagementException
        Register a route on a forwarder; this will create a new face on the forwarder towards the face (e.g., self registration).
        Parameters:
        face - only a localhost Face
        route - the Name prefix of the route
        cost - the numeric cost of forwarding along the route
        Throws:
        ManagementException - if the network request failed, the NFD response could not be decoded, or the NFD rejected the request

      • register

        public static void register(net.named_data.jndn.Face face,
                            String uri,
                            net.named_data.jndn.Name route,
                            int cost)
                     throws ManagementException
        Register a route on a forwarder; this will create a new face on the forwarder to the given URI/route pair. See register(Face, ControlParameters) for more detailed documentation.
        Parameters:
        face - only a localhost Face
        uri - the URI (e.g. "tcp4://10.10.2.2:6363") of the remote node; note that this must be one of the canonical forms described in the wiki (http://redmine.named-data.net/projects/nfd/wiki/FaceMgmt#TCP) for NFD to accept the registration--otherwise you will see 400 errors
        route - the Name prefix of the route
        cost - the numeric cost of forwarding along the route
        Throws:
        ManagementException - if the network request failed, the NFD response could not be decoded, or the NFD rejected the request

      • register

        public static void register(net.named_data.jndn.Face forwarder,
                            int faceId,
                            net.named_data.jndn.Name route,
                            int cost)
                     throws ManagementException
        Register a route on a forwarder; this will not create a new face since it is provided a faceId. See register(Face, ControlParameters) for full documentation.
        Parameters:
        forwarder - only a localhost Face
        faceId - the ID of the Face to assign to the route
        route - the Name prefix of the route
        cost - the numeric cost of forwarding along the route
        Throws:
        ManagementException - if the network request failed, the NFD response could not be decoded, or the NFD rejected the request

      • unregister

        public static void unregister(net.named_data.jndn.Face face,
                              net.named_data.jndn.ControlParameters controlParameters)
                       throws ManagementException
        Unregister a route on a forwarder

        Ensure the forwarding face is on the local machine (management requests are to /localhost/...) and that command signing has been set up (e.g. forwarder.setCommandSigningInfo().

        Parameters:
        face - only a localhost Face
        controlParameters - the ControlParameters command options
        Throws:
        ManagementException - if the network request failed, the NFD response could not be decoded, or the NFD rejected the request
        See Also:
        nfdc, RIB Management

                              net.named_data.jndn.Name route)
                       throws ManagementException
        Unregister a route on a forwarder.

        Ensure the forwarding face is on the local machine (management requests are to /localhost/...) and that command signing has been set up (e.g. forwarder.setCommandSigningInfo().

        Parameters:
        face - only a localhost Face
        route - the Name prefix of the route
        Throws:
        ManagementException - if the network request failed, the NFD response could not be decoded, or the NFD rejected the request
        See Also:
        nfdc, RIB Management

      • unregister

        public static void unregister(net.named_data.jndn.Face face,
                              net.named_data.jndn.Name route,
                              int faceId)
                       throws ManagementException
        Unregister a route on a forwarder; see

        Ensure the forwarding face is on the local machine (management requests are to /localhost/...) and that command signing has been set up (e.g. forwarder.setCommandSigningInfo().

        Parameters:
        face - only a localhost Face
        route - the Name prefix of the route
        faceId - the specific ID of the face to remove (more than one face can be registered to a route)
        Throws:
        ManagementException - if the network request failed, the NFD response could not be decoded, or the NFD rejected the request
        See Also:
        nfdc, RIB Management

      • unregister

        public static void unregister(net.named_data.jndn.Face face,
                              net.named_data.jndn.Name route,
                              String uri)
                       throws ManagementException
        Unregister a route on a forwarder

        Ensure the forwarding face is on the local machine (management requests are to /localhost/...) and that command signing has been set up using forwarder.setCommandSigningInfo().

        Parameters:
        face - only a localhost Face
        route - the Name prefix of the route
        uri - the URI (e.g. "tcp4://some.host.com") of the remote node (more than one face can be registered to a route)
        Throws:
        ManagementException - if the network request failed, the NFD response could not be decoded, or the NFD rejected the request
        See Also:
        nfdc command-line usage, RibMgmt

      • setStrategy

        public static void setStrategy(net.named_data.jndn.Face face,
                               net.named_data.jndn.Name prefix,
                               net.named_data.jndn.Name strategy)
                        throws ManagementException
        Set a strategy on the forwarder

        Ensure the forwarding face is on the local machine (management requests are to /localhost/...) and that command signing has been set up using forwarder.setCommandSigningInfo().

        Parameters:
        face - only a localhost Face
        prefix - the Name prefix
        strategy - the Name of the strategy to set, e.g. /localhost/nfd/strategy/broadcast
        Throws:
        ManagementException - if the network request failed, the NFD response could not be decoded, or the NFD rejected the request
        See Also:
        nfdc command-line usage, StrategyChoice

      • unsetStrategy

        public static void unsetStrategy(net.named_data.jndn.Face face,
                                 net.named_data.jndn.Name prefix)
                          throws ManagementException
        Set a strategy on the forwarder; see setStrategy(net.named_data.jndn.Face, net.named_data.jndn.Name, net.named_data.jndn.Name) for more information. Ensure the forwarding face is on the local machine (management requests are to /localhost/...) and that command signing has been set up (e.g. forwarder.setCommandSigningInfo()).
        Parameters:
        face - only a localhost Face
        prefix - the Name prefix
        Throws:
        ManagementException - if the network request failed, the NFD response could not be decoded, or the NFD rejected the request
